urlencoded.description: The type of grant to be acquired

request.description:
## API Endpoint: Obtain OAuth2 Token

This endpoint is used to obtain an OAuth2 access token from DeviantArt. It is essential for authenticating API requests on behalf of a user.

### Request

- **Method**: POST
    
- **URL**: `https://www.deviantart.com/oauth2/token`
    
- **Content-Type**: `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`
    

#### Request Body Parameters

The request body must be formatted as `x-www-form-urlencoded` and include the following parameter:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `grant_type` | text | Specifies the type of grant being requested. For this endpoint, it should be set to the appropriate value as per OAuth2 specifications. |

### Response

Upon a successful request, the API will return a response with a status code of `200 OK` and a JSON object containing the following fields:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `access_token` | string | The token that can be used for subsequent API requests. |
| `token_type` | string | The type of token issued (e.g., Bearer). |
| `expires_in` | integer | The lifetime in seconds of the access token. |
| `status` | string | The status of the token request (e.g., success). |

### Status Codes

- **200 OK**: The request was successful, and the access token has been returned.
    
- **Other Status Codes**: Various error codes may be returned depending on the nature of the error (e.g., invalid request, unauthorized access). Refer to the DeviantArt API documentation for more details on error handling.
    

Ensure that you handle the response appropriately in your application to manage access tokens and their expiration.

header.value: Private, no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, max-age=0, max-stale=0, post-check=0, pre-check=0

request.description:
### API Endpoint: Placebo

**Method:** GET  
**URL:** `https://www.deviantart.com/api/v1/oauth2/placebo`

#### Description

This endpoint is used to retrieve a placebo response from the DeviantArt API. It serves as a placeholder for testing purposes and does not require any request parameters.

#### Request Parameters

There are no request parameters required for this endpoint.

#### Expected Response

The response from this endpoint will be a JSON object containing a `status` key. The value of this key may vary but is typically an empty string.

``` json
{
  "status": ""
}

 ```

#### Notes

- This endpoint is primarily intended for developers to test their integration with the DeviantArt API without affecting any actual data.
    
- Since this is a placebo endpoint, it does not perform any operations or return meaningful data.

request.description:
## API Request: Get Gallery Items

This endpoint retrieves a list of gallery items from a user's DeviantArt gallery. It allows you to specify a username and pagination options to control the number of results returned.

### Request Method

- **GET**
    

### Endpoint

- `https://www.deviantart.com/api/v1/oauth2/gallery/all`
    

### Query Parameters

- **username** (string): The username of the DeviantArt user whose gallery items you want to retrieve.
    
- **limit** (integer): The maximum number of gallery items to return. This controls pagination.
    
- **offset** (integer): The starting point for the results returned. This is useful for paginating through multiple sets of results.
    
- **mature_content** (boolean): A flag indicating whether to include mature content in the results. Set to `false` to exclude mature content.
    

### Request Body

This request does not require a body, as indicated by the empty payload.

### Expected Response Format

The response will be a JSON object containing the following fields:

- **has_more** (boolean): Indicates if there are more results available beyond the current set.
    
- **next_offset** (integer): The offset to use for the next set of results if more items are available.
    
- **results** (array): An array of gallery item objects, each containing:
    
    - **deviationid** (string): The unique identifier for the deviation.
        
    - **printid** (string or null): The print ID associated with the deviation, if applicable.
        
    - **url** (string): The URL of the deviation.
        
    - **title** (string): The title of the deviation.
        
    - **is_favourited** (boolean): Indicates if the item is favorited by the user.
        
    - **is_deleted** (boolean): Indicates if the item has been deleted.
        
    - **is_published** (boolean): Indicates if the item is published.
        
    - **is_blocked** (boolean): Indicates if the item is blocked.
        
    - **author** (object): An object containing details about the author, including:
        
        - **userid** (string): The unique identifier for the author.
            
        - **username** (string): The username of the author.
            
        - **usericon** (string): The URL of the author's icon.
            
        - **type** (string): The type of user (e.g., "individual", "group").
            
    - **stats** (object): An object containing statistics about the deviation, including:
        
        - **comments** (integer): The number of comments on the deviation.
            
        - **favourites** (integer): The number of favorites the deviation has received.
            
    - **published_time** (string): The time the deviation was published.
        
    - **allows_comments** (boolean): Indicates if comments are allowed on the deviation.
        
    - **preview** (object): An object containing preview details, including:
        
        - **src** (string): The source URL of the preview image.
            
        - **height** (integer): The height of the preview image.
            
        - **width** (integer): The width of the preview image.
            
        - **transparency** (boolean): Indicates if the preview image supports transparency.
            
    - **content** (object): An object containing content details, including:
        
        - **src** (string): The source URL of the content image.
            
        - **height** (integer): The height of the content image.
            
        - **width** (integer): The width of the content image.
            
        - **transparency** (boolean): Indicates if the content image supports transparency.
            
        - **filesize** (integer): The size of the content image file.
            
    - **thumbs** (array): An array of thumbnail objects, each containing:
        
        - **src** (string): The source URL of the thumbnail image.
            
        - **height** (integer): The height of the thumbnail image.
            
        - **width** (integer): The width of the thumbnail image.
            
        - **transparency** (boolean): Indicates if the thumbnail image supports transparency.
            
    - **is_mature** (boolean): Indicates if the item is marked as mature content.
        
    - **is_downloadable** (boolean): Indicates if the item can be downloaded.
        

This endpoint is useful for retrieving a user's gallery items and managing pagination through the `limit` and `offset` parameters.

request.description:
## API Endpoint: Get All Collections

This endpoint retrieves a list of collections associated with a specified user on DeviantArt. It allows for pagination through the `limit` and `next_offset` parameters, and can include mature content based on the request.

### Request

**Method:** GET  
**URL:** `https://www.deviantart.com/api/v1/oauth2/collections/all`

#### Query Parameters:

- `username` (string, required): The username of the DeviantArt user whose collections you want to retrieve.
    
- `limit` (integer, optional): The maximum number of collections to return in the response. Default is typically set by the API.
    
- `mature_content` (boolean, optional): If set, the response may include collections that contain mature content.
    

### Response

**Status Code:** 200  
**Content-Type:** application/json

The response will be a JSON object with the following structure:

- `has_more` (boolean): Indicates if there are more collections available beyond the current response.
    
- `next_offset` (integer): The offset to be used for the next request if more collections are available.
    
- `results` (array): An array of collection objects, each containing:
    
    - `deviationid` (string): The unique identifier for the deviation.
        
    - `printid` (string or null): The print identifier, if applicable.
        
    - `url` (string): The URL of the collection.
        
    - `title` (string): The title of the collection.
        
    - `is_favourited` (boolean): Indicates if the collection is favourited by the user.
        
    - `is_deleted` (boolean): Indicates if the collection has been deleted.
        
    - `is_published` (boolean): Indicates if the collection is published.
        
    - `is_blocked` (boolean): Indicates if the collection is blocked.
        
    - `author` (object): Information about the author of the collection:
        
        - `userid` (string): The unique identifier for the author.
            
        - `username` (string): The username of the author.
            
        - `usericon` (string): The URL to the author's icon.
            
        - `type` (string): The type of the author (e.g., user, group).
            
    - `stats` (object): Statistics related to the collection:
        
        - `comments` (integer): The number of comments on the collection.
            
        - `favourites` (integer): The number of favourites the collection has received.
            
    - `published_time` (string): The time when the collection was published.
        
    - `allows_comments` (boolean): Indicates if comments are allowed on the collection.
        
    - `preview` (object): A preview of the collection:
        
        - `src` (string): The source URL for the preview image.
            
        - `height` (integer): The height of the preview image.
            
        - `width` (integer): The width of the preview image.
            
        - `transparency` (boolean): Indicates if the preview supports transparency.
            
    - `content` (object): The main content of the collection:
        
        - `src` (string): The source URL for the content image.
            
        - `height` (integer): The height of the content image.
            
        - `width` (integer): The width of the content image.
            
        - `transparency` (boolean): Indicates if the content supports transparency.
            
        - `filesize` (integer): The size of the content file in bytes.
            
    - `thumbs` (array): An array of thumbnail objects for the collection:
        
        - Each thumbnail object contains:
            
            - `src` (string): The source URL for the thumbnail image.
                
            - `height` (integer): The height of the thumbnail image.
                
            - `width` (integer): The width of the thumbnail image.
                
            - `transparency` (boolean): Indicates if the thumbnail supports transparency.
                
    - `is_mature` (boolean): Indicates if the collection is marked as mature.
        
    - `is_downloadable` (boolean): Indicates if the collection can be downloaded.
        

This endpoint is useful for retrieving user collections, allowing for better content discovery and management within the DeviantArt platform.
